meanings.definition: A person who shelves books or other items.
meanings.sent1: The shelvers at the library organize the books neatly.
meanings.sent2: The new shelver quickly learned how to alphabetize the books.
meanings.sent3: The shelvers had a race to see who could shelve the most books in an hour.
meanings.sent4: She was a shelver by day, but a bookworm by night.
meanings.sent5: The shelvers worked diligently to keep the library in order.

meanings.definition: The act of placing items on shelves.
meanings.sent1: Shelvers require precision to stack items without them falling.
meanings.sent2: Supermarkets rely on efficient shelvers to keep products organized.
meanings.sent3: The shelvers in the store played a game of 'shelf Tetris' to fit everything.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a shelver, neatly arranging thoughts and memories.
meanings.sent5: The shelvers in the warehouse worked tirelessly to stock the shelves.
